wifindus.eye

Class Atmosphere

  • java.lang.Object
    • wifindus.eye.Atmosphere
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Atmosphere
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An immutable, serializable packet of data describing the atmospheric condition at an object's location. Values within are represented with Java's boxing Double type to allow for incomplete data (as reporting devices may not fully report their conditions, or may lack sensors to do so).
    Author:
    Mark 'marzer' Gillard
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Atmosphere

        public Atmosphere(java.lang.Double humidity,
          java.lang.Double airPressure,
          java.lang.Double temperature,
          java.lang.Double lightLevel)
        Creates a new Atmosphere object.
        Parameters:
        humidity - The relative humidity (as a percentage) recorded by the device's hygrometer (if present). Use null for 'no data'.
        airPressure - Barometric pressure (in mbar) recorded by the device's pressure sensor (if present). Use null for 'no data'.
        temperature - Temperature (in degrees celcius) recorded by the device's temperature sensor (if present). Use null for 'no data'.
        lightLevel - Ambient light level (in lux) recorded by the device's light sensor (if present). Use null for 'no data'.

      • Atmosphere

          java.lang.Double temperature)
        Creates a new Atmosphere object.

        airPressure - Barometric pressure (in mbar) recorded by the device's pressure sensor (if present). Use null for 'no data'.
        temperature - Temperature (in degrees celcius) recorded by the device's temperature sensor (if present). Use null for 'no data'.

      • isEmpty

        public final boolean isEmpty()
        Tests if this is an entirely empty Atmosphere structure.
        Returns:
        TRUE if all members of this Atmosphere are NULL, FALSE otherwise.

      • getHumidity

        public final java.lang.Double getHumidity()
        Returns the relative humidity as a percentage
        Returns:
        A value between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive), or null (for no data).

      • getAirPressure

        public final java.lang.Double getAirPressure()
        Returns the air pressure in millibar
        Returns:
        A value greater than or equal to 0.0, or null (for no data).

      • getTemperature

        public final java.lang.Double getTemperature()
        Returns the temperature in degrees celcius
        Returns:
        A double, or null (for no data).

      • getLightLevel

        public final java.lang.Double getLightLevel()
        Returns the light level in lux
        Returns:
        A value greater than or equal to 0.0, or null (for no data).
